intro: Romulea toximontana, commonly known as the toxic mountain romulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a corm-like underground stem. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
